definition: to relieve a garrison/to change guard complement
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: There was one play where Udonis Haslem felt he had to switch.
sentences.chinese: 有一次防守中，哈斯勒姆觉得需要换防。

sentences.english: Is someone yelling at you to switch?
And ever the hastening of infantry shifting positions, batteries.
sentences.chinese: 不断地催促步兵团换防易站，换装填。

definition: to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
lit. strong soldiers and sturdy horses (idiom)/fig. a well-trained and powerful army
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
